title: Data Migration and Site Rebuild
description: Facing the end-of-life status of a PHP-based framework, a multi-billion dollar manufacturing company sought expertise to rebuild sites for seven of its subsidiaries and migrate over two million rows of data. Beginning as Discovery Lead, I led Technical Discovery including code and data exploration, estimation, and architecture. I also authored the technical strategy and identified technologies we planned to use, including Docker, CircleCI, PHPUnit, BackstopJS, and a popular enterprise-grade PHP-based framework.
summary: On this year-long engagement with a multi-billion dollar manufacturing client, I was Tech Lead on a team of more than ten developers to rebuild a network of subsidiary websites.
quote: Jordan led a very large effort to migrate a client's technical stack. This was an arduous process, requiring the migration of a massive amount of custom modules from an inherited codebase. This project required a great deal of coordination across a large team, which Jordan led with tremendous poise, skill, and humility. <mark>Jordan's dedication, determination and leadership was key to this project's success.</mark>

title: SparkHero!
description: What better way to learn how to build pure-JavaScript web applications without the use of a UI framework? While I co-led Sparkbox's Full Stack Developer program, I was tasked with improving and streamlining the apprenticeship curriculum. Enter SparkHero.
summary: An exciting practical exercise for Sparkbox Apprentices to refine their web application building skills.
quote: Jordan and I co-led our Full-Stack Development Apprenticeship for several years. He picked up the programming section after a team member moved on. Jordan redesigned the curriculum; our apprentices went from haphazard lectures and a college-style syllabus to defined, project-based learning with established goals and outcomes. He organized other members of the development team to teach lessons. He even created a template repository to provide an entry point for very junior developers to build new applications on their own. He's an accomplished mentor and efficient problem-solver. <mark>He makes people better just by working with them.</mark>

SparkHero is an exercise that challenges apprentices to build a JavaScript app with ready-to-go RESTful APIs that show off fan-favorite Marvel and DC characters. It covers all the disciplines previously addressed in ad hoc lessons on building web applications, but in a structured manner that closely resembles the leadership of real client projects. Throughout this two-week exercise, apprentices were tasked with adding new features such as support for fetching data from API endpoints, sorting, and filtering.
This project comes preloaded with three RESTful API endpoints compatible with
Netlify serverless functions
, Express, Webpack, Jest, Sass, a complete set of linters, and a customized CI/CD pipeline to automate deployments to Netlify for both pull requests and code merged into the production branch.

title: Billables Buddy
description: Billables Buddy was created out of a simple necessity: to help monitor your progress towards billable expectations when using Forecast for scheduling and Harvest for time tracking. It accomplishes this by leveraging data provided by public APIs from both platforms. It calculates billable expectations based on the user's starting time and the hours they've billed. Throughout the day, the status and estimated end-of-day progress are automatically recalculated based on real-time progress towards billable expectations set in Forecast. Breakdowns include expected and actual hours by type (billable and non-billable) and by individual project.
summary: A small but powerful xbar applet to keep track of billable expectations via Forecast and Harvest APIs.

title: Reaction Bot
description: Has a colleague ever posted something funny in Slack that you wish you could share with everyone? Inspired by Sparkbox's Gem Me Bot, Reaction Bot is a configurable Slack app designed to run in Slack channels and capture various reactions to messages and post them to specified channels. Just register a list of emoji reactions to listen for and specify the channel to post in, and you're ready to go! Once running, Reaction Bot automatically listens for reactions using Slack's WebSocket and Events API.
summary: An installable Slack app designed to capture reactions to messages.
quote: One of my favorite things about Jordan is how he brings joy to his daily work. With a good touch of humor and humility, he finds ways to elicit collaboration from each team member, celebrate their successes, and support them as they learn new things. <mark> He creates a collaborative and fun culture within his project teams that make them the envy of all the other project teams.</mark>

title: BSF/BPF
description: The Bicentennial Scholars/Professors pages are two interactive and highly engaging pages for the new initiatives from the University of Virginia. Based on Alderman Core, these pages are the primary online presence for the combined $375M fundraising effort of these programs.
summary: An engaging new scholarship program needs an engaging new web presence.

children.value: The Bicentennial Scholars/Professors pages are two interactive and highly engaging pages for the new initiatives from the University of Virginia. Based on Alderman Core, these pages are the primary online presence for the combined $375M fundraising effort of these programs.

Both pages utilize centralized modular components as well as page-specific elements. Customized features like animating circles, a field of parallax images that move with the user's scroll, and an odometer tracking fundraising progress contribute to the page's unique personality.

These pages were engineered with quality in mind. Instead of using images, animated circles and parallelograms were coded for performance and fidelity. While using images for various shapes is simpler, coding them provides greater flexibility with animations and ensures clarity on high-resolution displays. Another example of this attention to quality concerns animations, which are triggered using the IntersectionObserver API for scroll-based animations as the user scrolls down the page. This has a performance boost instead of the traditional approach of binding scroll events on the entire document. Despite the time-consuming nature, both pages were engineered within a week.

title: Force Refresh
description: Force Refresh is a lightweight WordPress plugin born out of a simple necessity: the capability to prompt users to refresh their browsers on single-page applications. This plugin enables site owners to prompt users currently connected to their website to refresh their browsers. It achieves this by storing current site and page versions as hexadecimal representations of the time the refresh was requested. Subsequently, browsers periodically check if the stored site version matches the current site version, and if not, invoke a page refresh.
summary: A WordPress plugin for forcing page refreshes.

title: Lawn Challenge
description: How do you raise over $50M to restore the historical Academic Village? The first step is developing a website to report real-time progress towards the fundraising goal. The Lawn Alumni Challenge website aims to inspire Lawn residents to donate to their individual rooms and foster competition among past Lawnies to raise $53M to restore the iconic Jefferson village.
summary: The Lawn Alumni Challenge is an ambitious campaign to restore UVA's Academical Village.

This project involved extensive frontend development and engineering of systems to provide fundraising data from the University's donation platform. The graphic representation of the Academic Village was created with special attention to the unique dimensions of the Pavilions and their proportions to individual lawn rooms. Rendered from a single JSON file, details such as individual lawn room sizes and the location of walkways help orient users seeking to identify a specific room.
The website relies on asynchronous requests to our central transaction APIs to retrieve up-to-date donation information.

title: SignupKit
description: SignupKit is the official framework by UVA Advancement Communications to sign users up for email publications sent through the constituent management system, iModules. The included API, designed to be used in a RESTful call, transmits data via a proxy to a public API (SignupCore) maintained by Advancement Communications.
summary: The official framework by UVA Advancement Communications to sign users up for email publications.

children.value: SignupKit is the official framework by UVA Advancement Communications to sign users up for email publications sent through the constituent management system, iModules. The included API, designed to be used in a RESTful call, transmits data via a proxy to a public API (SignupCore) maintained by Advancement Communications.

When transmitting an entry, data is sent to SignupCore as a JSON web token through a proxy file on the individual installation's server. The transmitted data is encrypted using a unique shared secret assigned to each individual installation and decrypted by SignupCore.

title: GivingToHoosDay
description: Building on the momentum from the previous year, GivingToHoosDay 2017 showcases a refined user interface, revamped frontend JavaScript, and a completely redesigned administrator backend. New interactive features, including maps, provide users with engaging ways to visualize incoming gifts during the University of Virginia'''s 24-hour giving event
summary: The award-winning site for the University of Virginia's official 24-hour giving event.

children.value: Building on the momentum from the previous year, GivingToHoosDay 2017 showcases a refined user interface, revamped frontend JavaScript, and a completely redesigned administrator backend. New interactive features, including maps, provide users with engaging ways to visualize incoming gifts during the University of Virginia'''s 24-hour giving event

The site operates entirely on callbacks, effectively eliminating the need for users to manually refresh their browsers. Visual representations of donations, including totals, leaderboards, and maps, are updated incrementally. Newly updated content areas are rendered using HandlebarsJS

GivingToHoosDay 2017 also introduces new templates for UVA schools and programs to showcase their sections on the official site. This allowed forty-three individual units to easily customize their pages and engage with their audience.

The 2017 site relies on a newly introduced ReSTful API to retrieve up-to-date giving information. Similar to the 2016 version of the site, the API delivers data from our caching system, ensuring secure transmission, encryption, and storage of donation information.

GivingToHoosDay 2017 raised over three million dollars and 7,000 gifts: nearly one million dollars and more than 1,200 gifts more than GivingToHoosDay 2016. In addition, our website was the winner of the District III Council for Advancement and Support of Education (CASE) Grand Award, the top award for a category, for Fundraising Website or Microsite.

title: iModules Cache
description: Powering the University of Virginia's central giving websites is the iModules Caching System, an automated system designed to securely collect and encrypt gifts made to the University through the iModules donation platform. The system reports real-time gift information through a series of ReSTful APIs, providing data to some of our most compelling sites and storing information for over fifty-million dollars in transactions.
summary: The caching system behind UVA's giving sites responsible for securely storing fundraising data.

children.value: Powering the University of Virginia's central giving websites is the iModules Caching System, an automated system designed to securely collect and encrypt gifts made to the University through the iModules donation platform. The system reports real-time gift information through a series of ReSTful APIs, providing data to some of our most compelling sites and storing information for over fifty-million dollars in transactions.

The system, which runs every five minutes, automatically determines the correct date and time parameters to return data based on previous successful calls. Using the SOAP protocol, the system returns donation data as XML, de-duplicates data, assigns unique IDs, and encrypts and stores values.

The system is also designed to be expandable for developers. Developers can easily add or extend their own functionality during the caching process using a series of predefined hooks. At the University of Virginia, we utilize the hook functionality to execute additional calls to the iModules API and send email notifications to UVA fundraisers using Amazon Web Services' Simple Email Service.

title: Alderman
description: At the core of the University of Virginia's central giving sites is Alderman: a highly customizable and powerful parent theme. At its base, Alderman Core provides an incredibly flexible admin interface with a core set of modular UI elements. These elements give the editorial team maximum versatility and ease of use when creating or editing new content, drastically decreasing turnaround time for creating new pages while ensuring creative freedom.
summary: Alderman Core: the powerful theme behind the University of Virginia's giving sites.

children.value: At the core of the University of Virginia's central giving sites is Alderman: a highly customizable and powerful parent theme. At its base, Alderman Core provides an incredibly flexible admin interface with a core set of modular UI elements. These elements give the editorial team maximum versatility and ease of use when creating or editing new content, drastically decreasing turnaround time for creating new pages while ensuring creative freedom.

On the technical end, this theme is a carefully-considered result of our site's evolution. Using best practices in dependency management and performance optimization, Alderman is a powerhouse. Centralized modular elements within a core theme mean modification or feature expansion is a breeze. Useful shortcodes make SVG animations, mobile-ready background videos, and adding additional stylesheets or scripts almost effortless.
The frontend of all Alderman themes is built on Sass and jQuery, which is transpiled into common JavaScript using Grunt. The backend is built on PHP, while the APIs are built using Slim and Guzzle.
